page.title: 01A Summary of the Cotswolds.
page.content: The area we are studying is in the county of{Gloucestershire.} It is situated in the{Cotswold Hills.} The Cotswold Hills are formed of limestone. Limestone is grey,white or yellow.It is sometimes very hard.It is made out of layers.Limestone rock is made from the skeletons of a great number of marine creatures. It may have fossils in it. The height of the land rises from{ {200}to{760}feet above sea level.The area has many wells and springs. The area is mainly farmland.There are a few villages nestling between the hills. There is some woodland which is made up of deciduous and coniferous trees. There are a few country roads along the valley bottoms. In a field there are a few mounds, the remains of{Kinley Priory}(Saxon).
